intro: Conostephium minus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its berries are red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Conostephium minus plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for native wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of its host trees.
